The risk of something getting false flagged though is absolutely terrifying to me.
No need to be. You can always appeal. True "false flagging" is EXTREMELY rare. And take it from me - I've created 2,500+ videos, and collected a sizable group of haters in my 10 years on the site. Believe me, if you could 'false flag' a channel - I'd have been gone long ago.
Luckily, that's not how YouTube actually works!

Portal 2 is so much better, which is actually confusing, because I rated Portal 1 a 9/10. Better story, longer experience, more gimmicks / puzzles / challenges, etc.
And the addition of community-made maps allows for basically never-ending gameplay. It's phenomenal.
I'd also recommend Portal: Prelude, and Portal: Pro - both are free 3rd-party mods/creations with limited stories. Fun, and challenging though!

The entire second monitor is your bin? I feel like that's an awful allocation of space.
As for how to correct it - adjust the color/brightness etc. on each monitor using a reference video or test image until they look as close as possible to each other.
You don't need cable to watch NBC. It's free, OTA.
If that's you're editing rig - may I recommend correcting the color-timing between your monitors? They're both different.

So we aren't that depend on just add money.
Lucky you! Not only were the concepts of sponsored-videos not a thing back in 2007-2011, but no company wanted to touch our show. It was deemed to risky and dangerous. As it is, most of our best episodes are age-restricted, and don't even earn AdSense revenue :-(
But if you ever want to collaborate on a video/project in some way - I'd certainly be interested! Keep up the good work.

WRITING.TEXT:
#RPM.
The term you're looking for is "RPM" = revenue per thousand.
And the site-wide average, in 2016 is around $1. Before 2012 or so, it used to be average closer to $2.5, and upwards of $10 for long-form, multiple-ad content.
And coincidentally, those first three were my favorite film for each respective year. Here's hoping the trend continues!
Thanks :-)

As YouTube's resident microwave expert - I am surprised and impressed to say I've never seen anything like this.
I must destroy one.

The creator(s) are struggling to make a living
I don't know if "Struggling" is the right word, but revenues are certainly way down. Unfortunately, it's due to YouTube's changing CPM values and algorithms - so even if we had the same viewership as in Microwave's heyday (in fact, we're not far off) - revenue would still be 20% of what it used to be.
Anyway, I approve of this idea! Please come back and visit, I'm still making new content every day!

Atlantic City is better than any one track from "Magic", but collectively - I enjoy far more songs from the latter, than "Nebraska".
But that's just me :-)
Magic Nebraska

Coming from NH through the rush hour, and then concert-traffic meant I spent about 5+ hours on the road yesterday, but it was 100% worth it. 11th show I've seen of his (at least one from each E Street tour since The Rising) - and this was unquestionably the best I've ever seen. So, my three things:
* The weather / vibe. Clear skies, a cool breeze - and everyone was just having an absolute blast. I kept looking up to the full moon and thinking how it was a perfect summer evening to close out the tour.
* That string of songs towards the middle of the set, "Lost In The Flood" "Kitty's Back" "Incident" "Rosalita" into "No Surrender" and "Boom Boom" "Darkness On The Edge Of Town" was downright phenomenal. I was on cloud 9 the entire time.
* Bruce's political 'speech' before 'Long Walk Home" - a real underrated gem from the "Magic" album. Admonishing the state of politics today, he seemed ready to say something - possibly an endorsement of Hillary, or something definitive against Trump? But you could hear him stop himself short, and just decided to introduce the song. It was a unique moment - curious what he was planning to say.
Wonderful evening. Third longest ever for him - and "Jungleland" was just poetry.
Foxboro says August 14th. You meant last night's show, right?

He seemed particularly sentimental at tonight's Boston show, so the thought had crossed my mind. The entire band is still playing out of their mindsb though - so I'd bet we'll get another five years or so before any sort of finale.
